body.name: The Titan's Curse: The Graphic Novel (Percy Jackson and the Olympians Series, Book 3)
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Dc953's book lounge! and Fulfilled by Amazon.
editorialReviews: Editorial Reviews About the Author RICK RIORDAN is the author of all the books in the New York Times #1 best-selling Percy Jackson and the Olympians series: The Lightning Thief, The Sea of Monsters, The Titan’s Curse, The Battle of the Labyrinth, and The Last Olympian. His other novels for children include the New York Times #1 best-selling series The Kane Chronicles (The Red Pyramid, The Throne of Fire, and The Serpent’s Shadow) and The Heroes of Olympus (The Lost Hero, and The Son of Neptune). He lives in San Antonio, Texas with his wife and two sons. Learn more at RickRiordan.com.Robert Venditti is the New York Times best-selling author of The Homeland Directive and The Surrogates, as well as The Surrogates: Flesh and Bone. He also adapted the New York Times best-selling The Lightning Thief, The Graphic Novel; The Sea of Monsters, The Graphic Novel; and Blue Bloods: The Graphic Novel. In 2012, he launched the critically acclaimed ongoing comic book series X-O Manowar. He lives in Atlanta, Georgia. Visit his Web site at RobertVenditti.com.Attila Futaki is the New York Times best-selling illustrator of The Lightning Thief, The Graphic Novel and The Sea of Monsters, The Graphic Novel. He also illustrated and colored Conan the Barbarian (written by Victor Gischler) and Severed (written by Scott Snyder and Scott Tuft). Attila studied at the International School of Comics in Florence, Italy. He lives in Budapest, Hungary. Visit AttilaFutaki.blogspot.com.Greg Guilhaumond studied drawing and animation at the European School of Visual Arts. After graduating, he worked in web and graphic design while also doing illustrations for various role-playing games and magazines and producing underground comics. Greg provided the colors for Severed. The Titan’s Curse, The Graphic Novel is his first book for children. He lives in Tours, France. Visit Doublegarga.canalblog.com.

body.description: A new prophecy leads to a dangerous quest.When Percy receives an urgent distress call from Grover, he immediately prepares for battle. He knows he’ll need his powerful demigod allies, Annabeth and Thalia, at his side; his trusty bronze sword, Riptide; and…a ride from his mom. The demigods race to the rescue, only to find that Grover has made an important discovery: two new powerful half-bloods, whose parentage is unknown. But that’s not all that awaits them. The Titan lord, Kronos, has set up his most devious trap yet, and the young heroes have just fallen prey. Now, Percy and his friends are faced with their most dangerous challengethe chilling prophecy of the Titan’s Curse. They must rescue the goddess Artemis by the Winter Solstice, or all will be lost…including Annabeth. Rick Riordan’s internationally best-selling The Titan’s Curse becomes a graphic novel in the hands of comic-book luminaries Robert Venditti, Attila Futaki, and Gregory Guilhaumond.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2023
reviews.reviewText: As always Percy Jackson is always a hit! The graphic novels are fantastic! Again I do prefer the original books but I do really love these graphic novels! I really wanted to give hugs to Nico and Bianca, and Zoe always makes me cry! Highly recommend if you love graphic novels and Percy Jackson!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Another excellent book!
reviews.reviewText: The third graphic novel in the Percy Jackson series continues the excellence of the first two! A different reading experience than the actual novels but just as fun! 5 stars!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2022
reviews.reviewText: My husband and 9 year old son love these books in a graphic novel format.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2023
reviews.reviewText: What a cool book it was suspenseful, and it got me wondering what happens next. the o God worthy book

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I love these books
reviews.reviewText: I love these books! I have loved all the Percy Jackson books, and others from Riordan. I finally talked my kids into reading these, but they prefer the graphic novels instead of the regular books. So I have both sets. Just waiting for the rest of the collection to be released as graphic novels so my kids can finish the story!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2013
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I'm a little biased
reviews.reviewText: I have already read all of the Percy Jackson books that are out there. And I have seen the movies which were't that great, but I liked the idea of getting to see the characters I have in my head when I read, enter the graphic novel. So far this is great, the comic book panels and the story line that has really been great it's a perfect match. These books add a level to the books I've already read. I feel like it's new all over again. Definitely recommend this!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2020
reviews.reviewText: Another great one in the books. While GNs. An not fit every aspect of the books into the story, I am pleased with what was added to this one. Also, Bessie is adorable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Graphic Novel
reviews.reviewText: I really love the drawings and colors used for the backgrounds and the characters. The story was exciting leaving me wanting more.I had only one problem with the graphic book style and that was the close up feature did not punch up the words enough and I had to use a magnifying glass to read it better.I hope in the future I will either learn a better way to read a graphic novel on Kindle or I find a better magnifying glass!

reviews.reviewTitle: Una novela gráfica que es necesaria para cualquier fan de Percy.
reviews.reviewText: Vale la pena tenerlo en tu colección, es una buena adaptación gráfica y la calidad muy buena.

Ya me había leído el libro y es uno de mis favoritos. Este formato es algo completamente distinto pero resulta muy interesante probarlo con una historia que ya has leído. Yo lo recomiendo si eres fan del autor.

WOW! toller Comic! Etwas klein geschrieben für die ältere Generation die nicht gerne ihre Brille trägt aber endilch mal ein Comic ohne Enten! Klasse Story mit griechischer Mythologie. Meine Tochter wollte es haben, da sie es gerade in der Schule durchnehmen, aber auch für mich eine kurzweilige Unterhaltung. TOP

reviews.reviewTitle: Everything You Wish The Movies Were
reviews.reviewText: The art is stunning; I often had to take a minute to just admire the work before actually reading a page. The characters and scenery were depicted exactly how the source novels described them as.The dialogue, just like the pictures, was taken directly from the novels as well, often word for word.Although they obviously needed to condense things a bit, it follows the same storyline, and all of the key events are present.This is a must-have for any fans of the books. Even if you're not one for graphic novels, I guarantee this may change your perspective a bit. As for those who haven't read the novels, this is a good way to jump into the world of Percy Jackson all the same.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 27, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: Love it - please hurry up with the next instalment
reviews.reviewText: Another great episode - desperate for the next book now we've finished this. Love Bob and Little Bob in this instalment. As always great humour and adventure.
